intro: Trichoscypha bijuga, commonly known as the African sand pear, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fissured bark and palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
